RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Ingenieria Mecnica - Universidad Francisco de Paula Santander (2001 - Colmbia), Mestrado (2004) e Doutorado (2009) em Engenharia Mecnica pela Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina- Brasil. Professor Adjunto C1 DE do Centro Tecnolgico de Joinville - CTJ/UFSC desde setembro de 2013, atuando principalmente no curso de Engenharia Automotiva. o coordenador do Laboratrio de Motores de Combusto Interna ? LABMCI/UFSC no campus de Joinville desenvolvendo atividades de ensino, pesquisa e extenso. Atualmente tem projetos de pesquisa em cooperao internacional com dois centros de pesquisa a nvel internacional; (a) o Instituto de Combusto e Dinmica de Gases IVG/UNIDUE, Alemanha, e (b) Centro de Qumica da Combusto ? C3/NUIG, Irlanda. Faz parte da equipe de trabalho do Laboratrio de Combusto e Engenharia de Sistemas Trmicos LABCET/UFSC. As atividades de pesquisa no IVG/UNIDUE, C3/NUIG, LABCET/UFSC e LABMCI/UFSC esto focadas ao desenvolvimento e formulao de combustveis para a indstria automotiva e aviao civil, no desenvolvimento de mecanismos cinticos para biocombustveis, etanol puro e substitutos de gasolina contendo etanol (Gasoline surrogates, Ethanol-based fuels), e querosene de aviao (Jet Fuel and Jet Fuel Surrogates) usando tcnicas experimentais para diagnsticos em processos de combusto. Tem experincia na rea de combusto de combustveis automotivos (etanol, iso-octano, n-heptano, tolueno e di-iso-butileno) e combustveis de aviao civil (substitutos: 1-methyl-naphthalene, n-hexadecane, i-cetane, NHM, methyl-cyclohexane) com nfase em cintica qumica, dinmica de fluidos computacional (CFD) e mtodos experimentais para diagnsticos em combusto, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Ignio trmica, Equilbrio qumico, Simulao de escoamento reativo, Cintica qumica detalhada, Experimentos de autoignio em tubos de choque, Experimentos em maquina de compresso rpida, Experimentos em reatores PSR, Experimentos em PFR e Experimentos em CVR, Motores CFR e Motores HCCI.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: He holds a degree in Mechanical Engineering - Universidad Francisco de Paula Santander (2001 - Colombia), MSc (2004) and Doctorate (2009) in Mechanical Engineering from the Federal University of Santa Catarina - Brazil. He is Professor Adjunct C1 DE of the Technological Center of Joinville - CTJ / UFSC since September 2013, acting mainly in the Automotive Engineering course. Currently have research projects in international cooperation with two research centers; the Institute of Combustion and Dynamics of Gases IVG - University Duisburg-Essen UDE, Germany, and the Laboratory of Combustion and Engineering of Thermal Systems LABCET Federal University of Santa Catarina UFSC, Brazil. Research activities at the IVG-UDE are focused on the development of kinetics mechanisms for pure ethanol, and for gasoline surrogates (Ethanol-based fuels), and Jet Fuel and Jet Fuel Surrogates using techniques for combustion process diagnostics. Research activities at LABCET-UFSC are focused on optimizing detailed kinetics models for pure ethanol and ethanol-containing gasoline substitutes. Another line of research at LABCET-UFSC is focused on the development and formulation of aviation fuels. He has experience in the combustion of automotive fuels (ethanol, iso-octane, n-heptane, toluene and di-isobutylene) and aviation fuels (substitutes: 1-methyl naphthalene, n-hexadecane, i-ketane, NHM , methyl-cyclohexane) with emphasis on chemical kinetics, computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and experimental methods for combustion diagnostics, mainly working on the following topics: Thermal ignition, Chemical equilibrium, Reactive flow simulation, Detailed chemical kinetics, Autoignition experiments in shock tubes, rapid compression machine experiments, PSR reactor experiments, PFR experiments and CVR experiments. It is also member of the of Internal Combustion Engines Laboratory - LABMCI / CTJ / UFSC developing teaching, research and extension activities

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pruebas de campo para los quemadores atmosfricos a gas LP del horno piloto para tratamientos trmicos utilizando el procedimiento de anlisis de gases ORSAT, en los productos de combustin variando las dimensiones en la direccin axial y las reas en sentido transversal al flujo de gas en los quemadores. Pruebas de campo para los quemadores atmosfricos a gas LP del horno para tratamientos trmicos, haciendo variaciones en las reas de flujo de mezcla aire/combustible, en la cabeza de fuego de los quemadores determinando las longitudes ptimas por mtodo experimental para que no se presente el fenmeno de retorno de llama o el de desprendimiento de llama, generado por las variaciones en la velocidad de la mezcla debido a un cambio en la presin del gas que generan velocidades de propagacin de la mezcla con valores muy por debajo o por encima del valor de la velocidad de propagacin del frente la llama en la combustin, determinando por mtodo experimental un valor un poco diferente al valor terico del campo de regulacin del quemador.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de mecanismos cinticos para a combusto de hidrocarbonetos e etanol com enfoque no uso de tcnicas de modelagem molecular direcionadas ao desenvolvimento e otimizao de modelos cinticos detalhados para a combusto de etanol e substitutos de gasolina contendo etanol.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Gaseificao de Carvo Mineral Nacional e Coque de Petrleo Visando a Produo de Gs de Sntese.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estudar o processo de gaseificao dos carves nacionais, coque de petrleo e misturas coque/carvo mineral com H2O e O2 ou ar, e CO2 sob diferentes condies de temperatura e presso, para demonstrar os potenciais de suas utilizaes como precursores carbonosos para a produo de CO e H2, alm de otimizar a formao de hidrognio nos produtos gasosos. Desenvolver modelos fenomenolgicos detalhados que possam, tanto fornecer dados sobre os fenmenos envolvidos na gaseificao, como ser usados posteriormente no dimensionamento de equipamentos. Com base nessas informaes, definir as melhores condies de reao e quais sero os processos mais adequados para a gaseificao desses combustveis.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Technical feasibility study of technologies to increase vehicle efficiency in internal combustion engines
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This line of research aims at exploring technologies for increasing vehicular energy efficiency. This proposal focus on the exploratory study of two technologies: (1) Chemical EGR for fuel-flex engines and (2) mechanisms for the operation of the internal combustion engine following the Atkinson cycle. This work will be developed as a short-term preliminary study, including (1) searching the state-of-the-art in these technologies, (2) describing the reasoning behind possible solutions, (3) simulating the possible gains in adopting solutions, (4) defining targets for future development. The results of this study will support BMW in the decision of investments in research on these topics.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Analise numrica do campo de escoamento externo na geometria de referncia Ahmed para aplicaes automotivas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto visa a utilizao e aplicao de ferramentas computacionais para a anlise da aerodinmica de veculos de estrada: (a) Automveis de passeio, (b) Veculos comerciais e (e) Veculos de competio. O projeto visa o uso de programas de dinmica de fluidos computacional como ferramenta de apoio ao entendimento dos campos de escoamento ao redor de corpos (geometrias simplificadas e aproximadas s de automveis reais) de estrada assim como a avaliao numrica das contribuies de arrasto e sustentao em cada um dos componentes dos corpos analisados (espelhos, cap, rodas, cavidade das rodas, spoilers, para-lamas, traseira do automvel, altura da traseira, inclinao do para-brisa, etc.) no intuito de analisar possveis locais (componentes dos corpos) para serem otimizados reduzindo o arrasto e simultaneamente o consumo de combustvel do automvel. Outro foco do projeto visa analisar o acoplamento dos escoamentos interno e externo ao redor do veiculo, no intuito de entender estes processos de interao assim como propor solues em termos de arrefecimento de componentes internos do automvel (motor, freios, caixa de transmisso, etc.).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The study of ignition delay for practical fuels in the low to intermediate temperature range (700 to 1100 K) in shock tube requires test times of the order of milliseconds. The test time available in practical devices is however limited by the arrival of the contact surface and the conditions in the igniting mixture are affected by the growth of boundary layers. In this paper, we simulate the non-reactive shock wave propagation by computational fluid dynamic as a tool to aid understanding the influence on boundary layer effects. The simulation is applied to the high pressure shock tube of IVG at the University of Duisburg-Essen. The prediction of shock speed, pressure and temper- ature are compared to measurements and to the output of CHEMKIN's SHOCK package.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecnica de Fluidos e Transferncia de Calor Computacional

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Assessoria Ou Consultoria de Arquitetura Ou Engenharia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. In this work, a numerical study of the flame-solid interaction in propane and n-butane supported flames is presented. The fuel-air partially premixed flames (stoichiometric ratio of 0.6) are attached to an orifice in the top side of a circular stainless-steel plate. The flow ranges from laminar to slightly turbulent, which is typical of domestic applications. The analysis employs a turbulence model (κ-ε model) and a global single-step chemical reaction mechanism for the gas phase and conduction heat transfer along the steel plate. The geometry is axisymmetric and the equations are solved using the CFD solver FLUENT. Two methods for the chemistry-turbulence interaction are tested and the results are compared. The coupling of the solid and gas phases render the solution expensive in terms of computational time. This is a serious drawback for the use of more complex chemical reaction mechanisms. The results evidence the role of the heat recirculation along the steel plate to the unburned gas mixture in the flame temperature and flame speed. Results are presented for both fuels, evidencing the effects of the ratio between chemical kinetic characteristic time scale and convection-conduction corresponding time scales. Surface heat transfer convection coefficients are also presented.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecnica de Fluidos e Transferncia de Calor Computacional

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Assessoria Ou Consultoria de Arquitetura Ou Engenharia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: RESUMEN El siguiente trabajo analiza numricamente el proceso de combustin, en un quemador tipo corona de operacin atmosfrica, usando un cdigo comercial CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics). El combustible utilizado es metano. Es analizada una configuracin geomtrica de quemador, caracterizando la respuesta fluido-dinmica que genera, utilizando un mecanismo cintico global. Se analizan aspectos del modelo de turbulencia empleado, y concentraciones de especies qumicas. Es usado el modelo Eddy Dissipation Concept (EDC) para la interaccin cintica-turbulencia.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: AUTOIGNITION OF GASOLINE SURROGATE MIXTURES AT INTERMEDIATE TEMPERATURES AND HIGH PRESSURES: EXPERIMENTAL AND NUMERICAL APPROACHES

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outros Servios Coletivos, Sociais e Pessoais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract Ignition-delay times were measured in shock-heated gases for a surrogate gasoline fuel comprised of ethanol / iso-octane / n-heptane / toluene at a composition of 40/37/10.2/12% by liquid volume with a calculated octane number of 98.8 using a blending program proprietary to Shell. The experiments were carried out in stoichiometric mixtures in air behind reflected shock waves in a heated high-pressure shock tube. Initial reflected shock conditions were as follows: Temperatures of 690 ? 1200 K and pressures of 10, 30 and 50 bar. Ignition delay times were determined from CH* chemiluminescence at 431.5 nm measured at a sidewall location. The experimental results are compared to simulated ignition delay times based on detailed chemical kinetic mechanisms. The main mechanism is based on the primary reference fuels model (PRF), and sub-mechanisms were incorporated to account for the effect of ethanol and/or toluene. The simulations are also compared to experimental ignition-delay data from literature for ethanol / iso-octane / n-heptane (20/62/18% by liquid volume) and iso-octane/n-heptane/toluene (69/17/14% by liquid volume) surrogate fuels. The relative behavior of the ignition delay times of the different surrogates was well predicted, but the simulations overestimate the ignition delay, mostly at low temperatures.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work proposes a detailed kinetic model for the thermal oxidation of ethanol/air mixtures at intermediate temperatures and high pressures, validated against ignition delay times measured in a shock tube behind reflected shock waves. Ignition delay times were measured under stoichiometric conditions at 10, 30, and 50 bar and from 650 to 1220 K.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The study of ignition delay for practical fuels in the low to intermediate temperature range (700 to 1100 K) in shock tube requires test times of the order of milliseconds. The test time available in practical devices is however limited by the arrival of the contact surface and the conditions in the igniting mixture are affected by the growth of boundary layers. In this paper, we simulate the non-reactive shock wave propagation by computational fluid dynamic as a tool to aid understanding the influence on boundary layer effects. The simulation is applied to the high pressure shock tube of IVG at the University of Duisburg-Essen. The prediction of shock speed, pressure and temper- ature are compared to measurements and to the output of CHEMKIN's SHOCK package.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. The present work proposes a detailed kinetic model for the thermal oxidation of ethanol-air blends at high and intermediates temperatures. The kinetic model is the result of a blending process using kinetics models for ethanol available in the literature and upgrades data for key reactions in the ethanol oxidation available of computational chemistry. Values of ignition delay time in shock tube are compared with experimental data. The experimental and numerical results of ignition delay time for the system ethanol ? air does not shows visibly a negative temperature coefficient.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Spark ignition engines are widely used in light duty vehicles, in the past the majority was designed to run just with gasoline. Nowadays there is a global tendency to use gasoline- ethanol blends, due to the fact that there is a need for renewable energy sources and also because of the environmental concerns. In some countries, like USA, Brazil and also in European Union, there are laws which regulate the percentage of ethanol in gasoline. Thus, the main intentions of the engine manufacturers are increase the efficiency as well as the reduction of emissions. The objective of this research was study the influence of the quantity of ethanol in gasoline on the engine.s performance by evaluating its research octane number (RON). In this study, a gasoline surrogate composed by isooctane, n-heptane, toluene and diisobutylene was used to simulate a real gasoline. Seven different samples of gasoline- ethanol blends (E0, E10, E20, E30, E50, E85 and E100) were used to evaluate the influence of ethanol on the RON value. Experimental tests to determine the octane number of these samples were performed using a Cooperative Fuel Research (CFR) engine in the engine laboratory at the Ingolstadt University of Applied Sciences, in Germany. For those samples with a RON value below 100, the measurement procedures were based in the standard test method ASTM D2699, while for those with higher RON, the procedure utilized was based in a methodology used in some laboratories in the European Union, due to the fact that Tetraethyl lead is not used there. The results of the study show that the research octane number for the gasoline surrogate increases with the addition of ethanol. With these results it was possible to validate the gasoline surrogate used, proposed by Cancino et al. (2011), since this surrogate shows similar values and behavior when compared to real gasolines studied by Anderson et al. (2012).Increasing the percentage of ethanol in gasoline allows increasing the compression rat
